page.title: 12Scotton/Northorpe; Religion
page.content: The Rev Ian Stockton (married with three young children) is priest in charge at Scotton (St Genewys) and Northorpe (St John); weekly Sunday services are held in both villages: at Northorpe there are on average 8 communicants, at Scotton 30-35, considerably more at Easter, Harvest and Christmas. At Scotton members of the Sunday School (30 children and 5 helpers) join in the second part of the service after their meeting in the village hall. As Assistant Director of Training for Local Non Stipendiary Ministry, Ian Stockton is keen to build up the role of lay people in the ministry of the church and at St Genewys the two churchwardens now take it in turn to assist at communion. The last Methodist chapel in Scotton closed in 1969, Northorpe has weekly services at the chapel (av.7 present).
